alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Chattooga; Dade; Walker; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 11:27PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Catoosa, northern Whitfield, Walker, Dade and northwestern Chattooga Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1126 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Shady Grove to near Pisgah, and moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Ringgold, Trenton, Fort Oglethorpe, Rossville, Chickamauga, Trion, Varnell, Lookout Mountain, Tunnel Hill, Cohutta, Menlo, Center Post, Blue Spring, Fairview, Cloudland, Chattanooga Valley, Hooker, Cloudland Canyon State Park and Cooper Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
